plugins.name: Ethos
plugins.description:
Ethos offers a top-notch brand asset management software solution and tools to streamline and organize your digital assets effortlessly.

- Create and share your own custom brand showrooms as an interactive website and pdf, and showcase and maintain your branding best practices.

- Share your official brand copy, brand logos, brand colors, brand fonts, brand rules and custom brand sections.

- Deploy your brand voice and image correctly to activate your powerful brand position.

- Improve your existing brand copy to bring it to the next level with artificial intelligence.

- Make your brand more authentic and cohesive by generating expanded primary, secondary and monotone color palettes.

- Invite your team and clients to your official brand spaces, and enable collaboration on one or more brands at a time.


For any questions or feedback, feel free to ping us at team@yourethos.io

accepted.name: Ethos
accepted.description: Build, share, and grow your iconic brand with our complete AI-powered creative brand showroom. Visit https://www.yourethos.io/ for more. Free Figma widget.

plugins.name: Random Rectangle Maker
plugins.description:
This plugin was made for testing purposes to test the cursor AI. I used Cursor AI to write the code and ChatGPT to help design the cover and icon. It’s a quick example of how fun and fast building with AI tools can be.


With one click, the plugin adds a rectangle to your canvas. Each rectangle shows up in a random spot with a random bright color.


→ Made with the help of Cursor AI for coding

→ Visuals created with ChatGPT

→ Quick, simple, and fun to use

→ A small tool for creative ideas


I really enjoy working where design and code come together. If you’re building something creative like a design tool, plugin, or even a storytelling project, I’d love to connect.


Reach out anytime: hey@abdulwahab.design

Or connect on LinkedIn: linkedin.com/in/heyabdulwahab/

accepted.name: Abdul Wahab
accepted.description:
Senior Visual Design Analyst at Accenture Song
— — — 
I blend creativity and technical background to design beautiful efficient interfaces and experiences ◡̈

plugins.tagline: Random rectangles with colorful precision.

plugins.name: ComponentFiller AI
plugins.description:
ComponentFiller は生成AIを用いて、選択したフレームの原稿と、人間が用意したコンポーネントのコードを組み合わせ、コンポーネントに適切な原稿を入力したコードを返します（要APIキー／Gemini のAPIは無料で取得できます）


利用方法

  1. 利用するAIのAPIを選択
  2. APIキーを入力
  3. 利用する言語と、言語に合わせた基本のプロンプトを設定（任意）
  4. ベースとなるコンポーネントのコードを入力
  5. 利用したいフレームを選択
  6. コードを生成


注意事項：コードを生成するために、選択したAIサービスにデータが送信されます


---


ComponentFiller uses generation AI to combine the script for the selected frame with the component code prepared by humans, and returns a code with the appropriate script entered into the component (API key required).


How to use

  1. Select the AI ​​API to use
  2. Enter the API key
  3. Set the language to use and the basic prompt for the language (optional)
  4. Enter the base component code
  5. Select the frame you want to use
  6. Generate code


Please note: Your data will be sent to the AI ​​service of your choice to generate the code.
plugins.tagline: Insert the text from the design data into your code

plugins.name: QQT Random Number Generator
plugins.description:
This is a Figma plugin that replaces selected text with randomly generated numbers. It supports both Chinese and English language interfaces, has a clear visual hierarchy, and is simple and intuitive to operate.

Functional Features

1. Range Setting: You can set the minimum and maximum values of the random numbers (e.g., 20 - 50).

2. Decimal Place Setting: You can set the number of digits after the decimal point.

3. Thousand Separator Display: You can choose whether to insert a thousand separator in the number.

4. Custom Prefix and Suffix: You can add custom prefixes and suffixes, such as +, -, %, HKD, ¥, etc.

5. Chinese - English Switch: It supports quick switching between Chinese and English interfaces.


这是一个Figma插件，用于将选中的文本替换为随机生成的数字。支持中英文双语界面，视觉层次分明，操作简单直观。

功能特点

1. 区间设定：可以设置随机数字的最小值和最大值（例如20～50）

2. 小数位设置：可以设置小数点后的位数

3. 千分位显示：可以选择是否在数字中插入千分位分隔符

4. 自定义前后缀：可以添加自定义前缀和后缀，如+、-、%、HKD、¥等

5. 中英文切换：支持中英文界面快速切换
plugins.tagline: This is a Figma plugin that replaces selected text with randomly generated numbers.

plugins.name: Long side scaling
plugins.description:
Tired of manually resizing images within frames one by one, especially when you need them to fit a specific maximum dimension while keeping their aspect ratio? "Long Side Scaling" automates this task!


What this plugin does:

  1. It finds the first visible Rectangle node with an Image fill inside each selected Frame.
  2. It takes the dimension you provide (e.g., 1040px).
  3. It identifies whether the image's width or height is larger (the "longest side").
  4. It then proportionally resizes the image so that its longest side exactly matches the dimension you entered.


How to use:

  1. Select one or more Frames containing the images you want to resize.
  2. Run the "Long Side Scaling" plugin from the Plugins menu.
  3. The plugin window will show how many selected frames contain a suitable image.
  4. Enter the desired dimension (in pixels) for the longest side into the input field.
  5. Click the "Start" button.
  6. The images within the selected frames will be resized instantly!


Key Benefits:

  1. Batch Processing: Saves time by resizing images in multiple frames at once.
  2. Proportional Scaling: Guarantees your images won't be stretched or distorted.
  3. Consistent Sizing: Perfect for creating uniform image galleries, grids, or ensuring images don't exceed a maximum width or height.
  4. Simple Interface: Easy to use with just one input and one button.


Important Note:

This plugin specifically targets the first visible Rectangle node with an Image fill it finds directly within each selected Frame. Images inside groups within the frame, or images applied as fills to shapes other than Rectangles, will not be affected.
plugins.tagline: Scale images proportionally by their longest side.

130386.tagline: Scale images proportionally by their longest side.

plugins.name: FigJam Sticky Color Picker
plugins.description:
This is a plugin for setting the color of Sticky:

  1. Directly set the fill color of the Sticky.
  2. It is also able to set the color of the text within the Sticky.
  3. You can set the color for a single Sticky node, or for multiple selected Sticky nodes. Even more, you can directly select an area, and the plugin will automatically identify the Sticky nodes within the selected area and change their colors as well as the colors of the text.
plugins.tagline: Custom the color of sticky and sticky text

plugins.name: Flatten Vectors Within
plugins.description:
A simple plugin that flattens all vector shapes (such as rectangles, ellipses, lines, and paths) within each selected frame or group into a single vector layer. Each frame or group is processed individually, so layers aren’t merged throughout. It’s a quick way to clean up icons or illustrations and make overrides easier when turning them into components.


Created with the help of AI.


How to use the plugin

  1. Select one or more frames or groups that contain vector layers.
  2. Run the plugin.
  3. Each frame or group will now contain a single vector layer named Vector.

accepted.name: Ali Salem
accepted.description: A product designer driven by a sense of responsibility towards enabling and empowering others. Currently building Design Systems at Auth0.

plugins.tagline: Flattens vectors in each selected frame or group into one layer — processed separately.

plugins.name: LARA for Figma
plugins.description:
LARA is the flagship product of Lithero, the first AI company to design and build products specifically for pharma marketing teams. LARA is a custom-made AI that learns the nuances of pharma brands at lightspeed, supporting brand teams throughout the end-to-end content creation process.


The official LARA for Figma plugin brings the power of LARA Screen and LARA Claims to your workspace. Get actionable feedback on the compliance of your content at the point of creation, saving significant time downstream. LARA for Figma complements the content creation process by ensuring high quality and accuracy of created content. Shorten review cycles, reduce spend, and get the most out of Figma with LARA!


Key Features:

Claims

- Detect differences between created content and approved claims, enabling corrections before MLR

- Trace claims back to their references and associated safety text in LARA Claims for additional context


Safety Text

- Identify and insert any required safety text missing from the content

- Generate accurate & complete safety text blocks to insert into content


References

- Find potential approved references that could be used to substantiate claims

- Locate any claims that are missing citations to typically seen references


*Requires subscription to LARA Claims and Screen. For more information, visit https://www.lithero.com/
plugins.tagline: Bring the power of LARA to your process

plugins.name: XenVision
plugins.description:
Simplify your design review workflow by seamlessly exporting Figma designs to Xenvision. This plugin bridges the gap between Figma and Xenvision, enabling quick exports without leaving your workspace.


Key features:

• One-click export to Xenvision

• Maintain design fidelity during transfer

• Streamline your design review process

• Save time on manual exports and uploads


Perfect for teams using Xenvision as their design review platform. Export individual frames or entire pages directly from Figma to kickstart your design feedback process.
plugins.tagline: Export designs directly to Xenvision for streamlined design reviews

plugins.name: Contrast ◈ | WCAG + APCA
plugins.description:
Get both WCAG and APCA contrast validation in one seamless tool. Contrast ◈ brings familiar Figma styling and workflows to accessibility testing, making it easy to check compliance during design rather than after handoff.


Key features:

  1. Dual standard support: Traditional WCAG guidelines plus modern APCA perceptual contrast
  2. Native Figma UI design patterns
  3. Quick selection options that fit naturally into your existing design process
  4. Perfect for teams transitioning between contrast standards
  5. Immediate feedback to catch accessibility issues early


Whether you're meeting current WCAG requirements or preparing for future perceptual contrast standards, Contrast ◈ keeps your workflow smooth while ensuring your designs are accessible to all users.
plugins.tagline: Familiar Figma based UI for quick color contrast check beyond WCAG basics

138819.tagline: Familiar Figma based UI for quick color contrast check beyond WCAG basics

plugins.name: Icon Set Generator
plugins.description:
Turn a single icon into organized variable sizes, colors, and styles in a few clicks!


Streamline your arduous icon workflow in Figma. All you need to start is an icon in a frame, or in a component.


Icon Set Generator then helps you quickly create organized icon systems by duplicating and resizing frames, components, or variant sets into multiple sizes with custom stroke weights and an optional dark mode.


✅ Auto-generates variant size sets with consistent naming

✅ Lets you add dark mode (white) icon variants in a click

✅ Supports “group by existing properties” for when selecting an icon component with different variant styles already applied (filled, outline, etc).

✅ Perfect for creating multi-size icon libraries for web, iOS, and Android design systems


I'm a designer who was always faced with this pain point when creating icon sets to use in my design systems, this plugin has saved me hours, and I hope it can do the same for you!


Compatible with Material Design icons, Feather, Heroicons, and any custom SVG icons you drop into Figma.
plugins.tagline: Quickly generate multi-size icon sets & organized variants for Figma design systems.

140387.name: Icon Set Generator
140387.description:

Streamline your arduous icon workflow in Figma. All you need to start is an icon in a frame, or in a component.


Icon Set Generator then helps you quickly create organized icon systems by duplicating and resizing frames, components, or variant sets into multiple sizes with custom stroke weights and an optional dark mode.


✅ Auto-generates variant size sets with consistent naming

✅ Lets you add dark mode (white) icon variants in a click

✅ Supports “group by existing properties” for when selecting an icon component with different variant styles already applied (filled, outline, etc).

✅ Perfect for creating multi-size icon libraries for web, iOS, and Android design systems


I'm a designer who was always faced with this pain point when creating icon sets to use in my design systems, this plugin has saved me hours, and I hope it can do the same for you!


Compatible with Material Design icons, Feather, Heroicons, and any custom SVG icons you drop into Figma.
140387.tagline: Quickly generate multi-size icon sets & organized variants for Figma design systems.

plugins.name: Token Exporter
plugins.description:
Stop manually converting colors and start shipping faster


Token Exporter is a simple, friendly plugin that automates the export of your Figma color variables into production-ready code for multiple platforms, including iOS, Android, and the Web (CSS, Tailwind, and more).


It's a zero-config alternative to complex build tools like Style Dictionary, designed to make your design-to-development workflow seamless and error-free.



Benefits

  1. A Zero-Config Alternative to Style Dictionary: Get the power of a token transformation pipeline without the complex setup. Token Exporter works instantly from within the Figma UI, empowering designers and developers to move faster.
  2. Instantly Usable: Works out of the box with zero configuration required.
  3. Save Hours of Work: Automate tedious token conversion and focus on what matters.
  4. Eliminate Errors: Ensure perfect accuracy from design to code, every time.
  5. Actively Developed: Continuously updated with new features and improvements.



Supported Export Formats


Swift (iOS Development)

public extension UIColor {
static let primaryBlue = UIColor(red: 0.067, green: 0.533, blue: 0.933, alpha: 1.0)
static let secondaryGreen = UIColor(red: 0.133, green: 0.733, blue: 0.467, alpha: 1.0)
}


Android (XML)

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<resources>
<color name="primary_blue">#1188EE</color>
<color name="secondary_green">#22BB77</color>
</resources>


Flutter (Dart)

import 'package:flutter/material.dart';

class AppColors {
AppColors._();
static const Color primaryBlue = Color(0xFF1188EE);
static const Color secondaryGreen = Color(0xFF22BB77);
}


CSS (Custom Properties)

:root {
--color-primary-blue: #1188EE;
--color-secondary-green: #22BB77;
}


JSON (W3C Standard)

{
"colors": {
"primary": {
"blue": {
"$type": "color",
"$value": "#1188EE"
}
},
"secondary": {
"green": {
"$type": "color",
"$value": "#22BB77"
}
}
}
}


Tailwind CSS (JavaScript)

module.exports = {
theme: {
extend: {
colors: {
'primary': {
'blue': '#1188EE'
},
'secondary': {
'green': '#22BB77'
}
}
}
}
}




How to Use

  1. Organize Your Variables: Ensure your color variables are organized in Figma variable collections.
  2. Launch the Plugin: Open Token Exporter. It will automatically detect and display your collections that contain colors.
  3. Select Collections: Choose which color collections you want to export.
  4. Choose Formats: Select one or more export formats.
  5. Download Your Tokens: Click "Download" to get your perfectly formatted color token files.



--------------------------------------------------


Support & Feedback

Having issues or suggestions for improvement?

We'd love to hear from you!


❖ Send me an email

❖ Visit my Website

❖ Connect on LinkedIn



--------------------------------------------------


🔮 Future Updates

This is just the beginning! We are actively working on expanding Token Exporter to support more variable types.


Have a feature you'd love to see? Send me an email and let me know!
plugins.tagline: Export Figma variables to code for any platform.

140519.name: Token Exporter
140519.description:
Stop manually converting colors and start shipping faster


Token Exporter is a simple, friendly plugin that automates the export of your Figma color variables into production-ready code for multiple platforms, including iOS, Android, and the Web (CSS, Tailwind, and more).


It's a zero-config alternative to complex build tools like Style Dictionary, designed to make your design-to-development workflow seamless and error-free.



Benefits

  1. A Zero-Config Alternative to Style Dictionary: Get the power of a token transformation pipeline without the complex setup. Token Exporter works instantly from within the Figma UI, empowering designers and developers to move faster.
  2. Instantly Usable: Works out of the box with zero configuration required.
  3. Save Hours of Work: Automate tedious token conversion and focus on what matters.
  4. Eliminate Errors: Ensure perfect accuracy from design to code, every time.
  5. Actively Developed: Continuously updated with new features and improvements.



Supported Export Formats


Swift (iOS Development)

public extension UIColor {
static let primaryBlue = UIColor(red: 0.067, green: 0.533, blue: 0.933, alpha: 1.0)
static let secondaryGreen = UIColor(red: 0.133, green: 0.733, blue: 0.467, alpha: 1.0)
}


Android (XML)

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<resources>
<color name="primary_blue">#1188EE</color>
<color name="secondary_green">#22BB77</color>
</resources>


Flutter (Dart)

import 'package:flutter/material.dart';

class AppColors {
AppColors._();
static const Color primaryBlue = Color(0xFF1188EE);
static const Color secondaryGreen = Color(0xFF22BB77);
}


CSS (Custom Properties)

:root {
--color-primary-blue: #1188EE;
--color-secondary-green: #22BB77;
}


JSON (W3C Standard)

{
"colors": {
"primary": {
"blue": {
"$type": "color",
"$value": "#1188EE"
}
},
"secondary": {
"green": {
"$type": "color",
"$value": "#22BB77"
}
}
}
}


Tailwind CSS (JavaScript)

module.exports = {
theme: {
extend: {
colors: {
'primary': {
'blue': '#1188EE'
},
'secondary': {
'green': '#22BB77'
}
}
}
}
}




How to Use

  1. Organize Your Variables: Ensure your color variables are organized in Figma variable collections.
  2. Launch the Plugin: Open Token Exporter. It will automatically detect and display your collections that contain colors.
  3. Select Collections: Choose which color collections you want to export.
  4. Choose Formats: Select one or more export formats.
  5. Download Your Tokens: Click "Download" to get your perfectly formatted color token files.



--------------------------------------------------


Support & Feedback

plugins.name: ClientSim AI
plugins.description: ClientSim AI is a smart Figma plugin built for designers who want to practice and improve client communication, design decision explanation, and UX quality. Instead of exporting frames as images, the plugin reads your selected frame’s design structure — including layout, content, colors, and visual properties — and simulates a conversation with a virtual client.
plugins.tagline: Simulate client conversations and receive design feedback with AI-powered UX evaluations in Figma

140261.name: ClientSim AI
140261.description: ClientSim AI is a smart Figma plugin built for designers who want to practice and improve client communication, design decision explanation, and UX quality. Instead of exporting frames as images, the plugin reads your selected frame’s design structure — including layout, content, colors, and visual properties — and simulates a conversation with a virtual client.
140261.release_notes:
ClientSim AI is now live in its initial development phase! 🎉

This first version introduces core functionality including:

✨ AI-simulated client conversations based on your design

🔍 Heuristic evaluation using design properties (no image rendering)

📋 Support for client tone, persona, and feedback scoring

🧠 Fully text-based design analysis (no Vision API used)

⚠️ Note: This is an early release. For optimal performance:

Use smaller UI designs or individual sections for feedback

Avoid running on full homepages or complex multi-layered designs — token limits may result in errors

We’re working on optimizations for large-scale designs, token handling, and performance upgrades in the next version.
140261.tagline: Simulate client conversations and receive design feedback with AI-powered UX evaluations in Figma

plugins.name: Designer Performance Score
plugins.description:
🎯 Designer Performance Score

An advanced tool to help design teams and leads evaluate UI/UX designer efficiency across three key metrics:


  1. Acceptance Rate: How many screens got approved vs. how many were designed.
  2. Revised Rate: How many times a screen got revised before acceptance.
  3. UI Screens per Scenario: How many screens are created for each user scenario.


🔧 Comes with adjustable thresholds for each metric, dynamic feedback, and color-coded results to quickly detect efficiency bottlenecks.


Perfect for performance reviews, retrospectives, or mentoring sessions.


📚 Inspired by https://sedatcakir.net/blog/tasarimcinin-performansi-nasil-olculur
plugins.tagline: Score your design work using real metrics like acceptance rate and revision frequency. 🎯

plugins.name: Fybril
plugins.description:
Fybril is a design-to-analytics tool made for product teams. It helps you define what to measure in your design and product decisions—and see how those decisions perform through connected analytics. Fybril stands out by combining design understanding with analytics planning in one easy workflow.


Whether you're a product designer or a product manager, Fybril helps you track what matters, streamline communication with developers, and stay aligned with your goals.


With Fybril you can:

  1. Figma Plugin — Import your designs directly from Figma to start connecting design with events to track.
  2. Home View — Define the problem you're solving, outline product or business goals, and describe the solution you want to track and analyze.
  3. Flow View — Build a user flow using screens and text blocks. Set the first screen as the entry point to start preparing the event tracking plan.
  4. Events View—Manage all events and event properties linked to your screens. This creates a clear, visual tracking plan to guide developers on what to implement.
  5. Analytics View—See insights for your flow or sub-flows. (Currently support only Mixpanel)
  6. Share & Collaborate—Invite teammates to your workspace and share your tracking plan or complete documents (Home, Flow, Events, Analytics) for seamless collaboration.


Getting started video | Website﻿
plugins.tagline: Align teams with a shared tracking plan to drive smarter decisions

139819.name: Fybril
139819.description:
Fybril is a design-to-analytics tool made for product teams. It helps you define what to measure in your design and product decisions—and see how those decisions perform through connected analytics. Fybril stands out by combining design understanding with analytics planning in one easy workflow.


Whether you're a product designer or a product manager, Fybril helps you track what matters, streamline communication with developers, and stay aligned with your goals.


With Fybril you can:

  1. Figma Plugin — Import your designs directly from Figma to start connecting design with events to track.
  2. Home View — Define the problem you're solving, outline product or business goals, and describe the solution you want to track and analyze.
  3. Flow View — Build a user flow using screens and text blocks. Set the first screen as the entry point to start preparing the event tracking plan.
  4. Events View—Manage all events and event properties linked to your screens. This creates a clear, visual tracking plan to guide developers on what to implement.
  5. Analytics View—See insights for your flow or sub-flows. (Currently support only Mixpanel)
  6. Share & Collaborate—Invite teammates to your workspace and share your tracking plan or complete documents (Home, Flow, Events, Analytics) for seamless collaboration.


Getting started video | Website﻿
139819.tagline: Align teams with a shared tracking plan to drive smarter decisions

plugins.name: Screen Count
plugins.description:
Screen Count updates the numbers on your screen labels based on position (top to bottom, left to right). Just add the name of the label container, select the flow or frame you want to update, and hit "Renumber".


You can now use letters instead of numbers or choose to append to the existing text rather than replace it.

plugins.name: Design Rule Checker
plugins.description:
デザインシステムの一貫性を保つための自動チェックツールです。Figmaファイル内のデザイン要素を自動でスキャンし、設定されたデザインルールに違反している箇所を瞬時に検出します。


使い方

チェックしたい要素、または、ページを選択し「チェック開始」ボタンをクリック。

ルールに違反している要素の一覧が表示されたら、クリックして修正箇所を確認する。


主な機能

6つのチェック項目

  1. カラー: ライブラリ変数やスタイルが正しく適用されているかチェック
  2. フォント: 許可されたフォントファミリーとウェイトが使用されているかチェック
  3. 余白: 4pxグリッドに準拠した余白設定かチェック
  4. ボーダー: 適切なボーダー設定がされているかチェック
  5. サイズ: 4pxグリッドに準拠したサイズ設定かチェック
  6. レイアウト: オートレイアウトや制約が正しく設定されているかチェック


高度なフィルタリング機能

  1. 違反の種類別フィルタリング
  2. フレーム別フィルタリング
  3. レイヤー名での検索機能
  4. リアルタイムプレビュー
  5. カスタマイズ可能な設定
  6. 各チェック項目のON/OFF切り替え
  7. チェック対象ノードタイプの選択
  8. 非表示レイヤーの含む/含まない設定


使用シーン

  1. デザインシステムの品質管理
  2. チーム開発でのデザイン一貫性確保
  3. デザインレビュー前の事前チェック
  4. 新規メンバーのデザインルール教育


特徴

  1. 直感的なUI: ダークモード/ライトモード対応の美しいインターフェース
  2. 高速スキャン: 大量のレイヤーも素早くチェック
  3. 詳細な報告: 違反箇所をワンクリックでフォーカス
  4. 柔軟な設定: プロジェクトに合わせたカスタマイズが可能

デザインの品質向上とチームの生産性向上に貢献する、デザイナー必携のツールです。
plugins.tagline: デザインルール自動チェッカー

139447.description:

  4. 柔軟な設定: プロジェクトに合わせたカスタマイズが可能

デザインの品質向上とチームの生産性向上に貢献する、デザイナー必携のツールです。

139447.tagline: デザインルール自動チェッカー

plugins.name: Corner Radius Balancer
plugins.description:
Corner Radius Balancer

Tired of manually calculating corner radius for nested elements in Auto Layout? 😩

This plugin helps you automatically balance the corner radius relationship between a parent frame and its child element, based on the simple formula: Parent Radius = Child Radius + Padding.


How it Works

The plugin simplifies your workflow by linking the three key values. When you adjust one, the others intelligently update:

Adjust Parent Radius

Padding remains fixed, and Child Radius updates automatically.

Adjust Padding

Parent Radius remains fixed, and Child Radius updates automatically.

Adjust Child Radius

Padding remains fixed, and Parent Radius updates automatically.


Key Features

Quick Fix Button ⚡

Instantly corrects the corner radius relationship with a single click.

Real-time Preview

See your changes on the canvas as you make them in the plugin.

Sync with Figma UI

Changes made directly in Figma's properties panel are reflected in the plugin.

Supports Various Corner Patterns

Works with uniform, partial, and custom corner radii by preserving the differences between them.


How to Use 📝

Select a Parent Frame

Choose a parent frame that uses Auto Layout and contains a child rectangle.

Adjust Values

Use the sliders or input fields in the plugin to adjust the values.

Complete

Click "Done" when finished.
plugins.tagline: Automatically adjust nested corner radius values.

plugins.name: Thumbly
plugins.description:
Thumbly — Instant Project Thumbnails

Create beautiful project thumbnails — fast and professional. This plugin helps you generate stunning thumbnail covers for your projects, presentations, and portfolio content directly in Figma.


No need to design covers from scratch. Just enter your title, description, pick an emoji, choose a theme — and Thumbly generates a ready-to-use thumbnail frame in seconds.


Key features:

  1. Instant thumbnail generation with custom text
  2. 100+ project-themed emojis to choose from
  3. Light and dark theme presets
  4. Optimized 1920×960px cover size
  5. Built-in Auto Layout for precise structure

accepted.name: Pavel Grachev
accepted.description: Product designer. Focused on clarity, usability, and quality design systems.

plugins.tagline: Effortless thumbnail design for every project.

137647.name: Thumbly
137647.description:
Thumbly — Instant Project Thumbnails

Create beautiful project thumbnails — fast and professional. This plugin helps you generate stunning thumbnail covers for your projects, presentations, and portfolio content directly in Figma.


No need to design covers from scratch. Just enter your title, description, pick an emoji, choose a theme — and Thumbly generates a ready-to-use thumbnail frame in seconds.


Key features:

  1. Instant thumbnail generation with custom text
  2. 100+ project-themed emojis to choose from
  3. Light and dark theme presets
  4. Optimized 1920×960px cover size
  5. Built-in Auto Layout for precise structure
137647.release_notes: - added the ability to upload your own pictures as a logo
137647.tagline: Effortless thumbnail design for every project.

plugins.name: Rename by text list
plugins.description:
This plugin lets you rename multiple layers in bulk using a text-based list.

Simply select two Auto Layout frames:

  1. One containing the elements to rename (any layer type)
  2. One containing text nodes with the desired names

The plugin will rename each element in the first frame using the corresponding text content from the second frame, based on their order in the layers panel.
plugins.tagline: Rename one list of items by another list of text items

137516.name: Rename by text list
137516.description:
This plugin lets you rename multiple layers in bulk using a text-based list.

Simply select two Auto Layout frames:

  1. One containing the elements to rename (any layer type)
  2. One containing text nodes with the desired names

The plugin will rename each element in the first frame using the corresponding text content from the second frame, based on their order in the layers panel.
137516.tagline: Rename one list of items by another list of text items

plugins.name: Select Similar Layers (Smart)
plugins.description:
Helps you quickly select layers that match your selection — based on either the layer name or, for text layers, their actual content. Unlike Figma’s built-in options, it works across Frames, groups, and deeply nested structures.


– Matches text layers by both name and text content

– Restricts search to the nearest shared parent (component, frame, or group)
plugins.tagline: Select all layers that match your selection by name and text content

140506.name: Select Similar Layers (Smart)
140506.description:
Helps you quickly select layers that match your selection — based on either the layer name or, for text layers, their actual content. Unlike Figma’s built-in options, it works across Frames, groups, and deeply nested structures.


– Matches text layers by both name and text content

– Restricts search to the nearest shared parent (component, frame, or group)
140506.tagline: Select all layers that match your selection by name and text content

plugins.name: SDS App Tokens Export
plugins.description:
The plugin exports colour variables as tokens for iOs and Android using a predefined format.


The plugin assumes that there are Core and Semantic collections of variables, and also checks if a variable refers to a variable from another library.


For example, the core collection contains variables like Blue/0, Pink/100, which are given a hex colour.


Semantic collection contains aliased variables of the form Brand/Primary: Pink/100. If a variable does not contain an alias reference, it is converted as a core token.


Using

The plugin gives you a choice of collection, Mode and colour scheme, which is contained in the first level of naming in Semantic collections.


Outputs

  1. for Core iOS: public static let Blue0 = Color(hex: "FFFFFFFFFFFFF")
  2. for Core Android: val Blue0: Color = Color(colour: 0xFFFFFFFFFF)
  3. for Semantic iOS: BrandTextPrimary: Color.DSColorPalette.Pink900
  4. for Semantic Android: BrandTextPrimary = DSCorePalette.Pink900
plugins.tagline: Export variables for mobile

138220.name: SDS App Tokens Export
138220.description:
The plugin exports colour variables as tokens for iOs and Android using a predefined format.


The plugin assumes that there are Core and Semantic collections of variables, and also checks if a variable refers to a variable from another library.


For example, the core collection contains variables like Blue/0, Pink/100, which are given a hex colour.


Semantic collection contains aliased variables of the form Brand/Primary: Pink/100. If a variable does not contain an alias reference, it is converted as a core token.


Using

The plugin gives you a choice of collection, Mode and colour scheme, which is contained in the first level of naming in Semantic collections.


Outputs

  1. for Core iOS: public static let Blue0 = Color(hex: "FFFFFFFFFFFFF")
  2. for Core Android: val Blue0: Color = Color(colour: 0xFFFFFFFFFF)
  3. for Semantic iOS: BrandTextPrimary: Color.DSColorPalette.Pink900
  4. for Semantic Android: BrandTextPrimary = DSCorePalette.Pink900
138220.release_notes: Small adjustments to the output for iOS. Variables are output in lower case.

plugins.name: Reshaped Codegen (Unofficial)
plugins.description: After selecting the Frame created with Reshaped, select Reshaped in the Codegen settings. React code will be generated.
plugins.tagline: Generate designs made with Reshaped into React code

plugins.name: Intervallo
plugins.description:
Take mindful breaks and think through challenges with Intervallo's simple focus timer and reflection questions.


Features:


Focus timer with gentle break reminders

Guided reflection for common mental blocks

Daily motivational tips


Perfect for when you need to step back, breathe, and gain some clarity during your design work.
plugins.tagline: Focus better, pause gently, think clearly - all-in-one wellbeing companion
